Citation.Paragraph: Among the first fungi reported from Panama were rusts collected by N.G. Lagerheim (Dietel 1894
Citation.Name: Dietel

Citation.Paragraph: Since then, data on rust fungi (Uredinales, Basidiomycota) from Panama have been published by numerous authors: Arthur (1918
Citation.Name: Arthur

Citation.Paragraph: In total, only about 67 species of rust fungi are known from Panama (Piepenbring 2006
Citation.Name: Piepenbring

Citation.Paragraph: Species of Raveneliaceae (Uredinales) are particularly diverse on Fabaceae in the tropics (Hernandez and Hennen 2002
Citation.Name: Hennen

Citation.Paragraph: This family includes species in numerous genera, among which species of Dicheirinia , Diorchidium , Diorchidiella , Hapalophragmium , and Ravenelia are morphologically somewhat similar. Species of Dicheirinia differ from species of the other genera by vertically septate, tuberculate teliospores, subtended by a hyaline pedicel with one apical cell for each probasidial cell. The type species of the genus is D. binata (Berk. and M.A. Curtis) Arthur (= Triphragmium binatum Berk. and M.A. Curtis) on Erythrina sp. from Nicaragua. Twelve species of Dicheirinia have been described on the three subfamilies of Fabaceae (Cummins and Hiratsuka 2003
Citation.Name: Hiratsuka

Citation.Paragraph: Eight of the Dicheirinia species are known only from the Americas. D. archeri Cummins was described on L. nicou (Aubl.) DC. from Peru (Spaulding 1961
Citation.Name: Spaulding

Citation.Paragraph: and on L. urucu Killip and A.C. Sm. and L. utilis A.C. Sm. also from Peru (Spaulding 1961
Citation.Name: Spaulding

Citation.Paragraph: It has paraphysate uredinia, strongly echinulate urediniospores with three to four germ pores, and teliospores with two probasidial cells. D. guianensis Cummins was reported on L. nicou (Aubl.) DC. from French Guiana and Guyana (Cummins 1937
Citation.Name: Cummins

Citation.Paragraph: and on Lonchocarpus sp. from Brazil and Colombia (Buritica and Pardo-Cardona 1996
Citation.Name: Pardo-Cardona

Citation.Paragraph: Spermogonia and telia were reported for this species: teliospores mostly with three probasidial cells, (38) 44-55 (65) µm high and (36) 40-55 (59) µm wide, with tubercles or plaques up to 8 µm thick at the apex of the probasidial cells. D. ormosiae (Arthur) Cummins was reported on O. krugii Urb. from Puerto Rico, Santo Domingo, and Virgin Islands (Cummins 1935
Citation.Name: Cummins

Citation.Paragraph: Its uredinia and telia include characteristically branched paraphyses. D. solenioides(Henn.) Cummins was reported on Ormosia monosperma (Sw.) Urb. (= Ormosia dasycarpa Jacks .) and Ormosia sp. from Brazil (Cummins 1940
Citation.Name: Cummins

Citation.Paragraph: It produces uredinia and telia with cylindrical hyaline paraphyses, triangular, echinulate urediniospores, and teliospores with two prominently echinulate probasidial cells. D. spinulosa (J.W. Baxter) J.F. Hennen and Cummins was reported on Cassia sp. and Leucaena sp. from Mexico (Cummins 1978
Citation.Name: Cummins

Citation.Paragraph: It produces only telia, which have teliospores with two to eight probasidial cells. D. superba H.S. Jacks. and Holw., reported on Piptadenia sp. from Brazil (Cummins 1935
Citation.Name: Cummins

Citation.Paragraph: Four species of Dicheirinia were reported from outside the Americas. Dicheirinia canariensis Urries was reported on Chamaecytisus proliferus (L. f.) Link (as Cytisus proliferus L. f.), Cytisus congestus Ball, Cytisus perezii Hutch., and Teline canariensis (L.) Webb and Berth. (as Genista canariensis L. ) from Canary Islands (Gjaerum 1987
Citation.Name: Gjaerum

Citation.Paragraph: D. canariensis produced only telia, which are paraphysate, and the teliospores have two to three probasidial cells. Dicheirinia maderensis Gjaerum was reported on leaves of cf. Teline maderensis Webb and Berth. from Madeira (Portugal). We did not examine the type specimen of this species, but, according to Gjaerum (1982
Citation.Name: to Gjaerum

Citation.Paragraph: it produces uredinia with urediniospores subgloboid to ellipsoid, often attenuated at the apex, 27-31 x 18-21 Hm, echinulate, and telia with teliospores 20-29x 11 -13.5 Hm with few warts, while D. panamensis has larger urediniospores that are variable in shape and strongly tuberculate and larger teliospores with block-like tubercles. Dicheirinia trispora Cummins was reported on Abrus precatorius L. from Mauritius (Cummins 1960
Citation.Name: Cummins

Citation.Paragraph: it is microcyclic producing spermogonia and telia with teliospores 26-34x30-40 µm, which are smaller than those of D. panamensis . Dicheirinia viennotii B. Huguenin was reported on Archidendropsis granulosa (Labill.) I.C. Nielsen [= Albizia granulosa (Labill.) Benth.] from New Caledonia (Huguenin 1966
Citation.Name: Huguenin

Citation.Paragraph: Twenty-five new records of rust fungi for Panama are listed below, which bring the total of rusts known from Panama to 92. The considerable number of new records obtained, based on specimens collected in less than 1 week, suggests that we are still far from knowing the complete diversity of rusts in Panama. In Costa Rica, a neighboring country with similar plant diversity where rusts have been collected much more intensively than in Panama, 292 species are known (Berndt 2004
Citation.Name: Berndt

Citation.Paragraph: on Oxalis sp. Panama, Chiriqui Province, Caizan, 8°44.406TN, 82°49.348'W, leg. J. R. Hernandez 2004
Citation.Name: J. R. Hernandez
